ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I became a lot better at Spanish this term and learned how to adapt new skills quickly.

I learned to conjugate in the present, past, and future tenses. I learned to express myself on topics such as politics, the environment, chores, shopping, preferences, and so on. This course gave be a comprehensive basis for the Spanish language, one which I am sure will be incredibly useful as I move forward.
I feel my knowledge of spanish increase immensely during this course.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very engaging, well-planned. I really don't know how I would improve it.

The professor is a strength. She is a good teacher and really cares about her students. The weakness is the course format. a 2-hour class 4 days a week plus a minimum of 1.5 hours of homework is excessive.
Well run course, theres just a lot of work making it difficult to do well on all other courses that you are taking.

The course was very well organized. Class was normally efficient and effective. Perhaps there could be more, shorter activities during class time that force students to exchange in Spanish but don't require long preparation times.

I feel that the class is pretty much what I signed on for. I do think it's a lot of work and that there could me more time spent reviewing the grammar in particular in class and in the assignments, especially in the beginning as we get our grounding.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would because you develop great Spanish speaking skills very quickly, however, it is a lot of work each night.
Yes: to any student who wishes to obtain a solid foundation for their Spanish, this course is perfect.

I would recommend only if they are prepare for the workload. this was like having another graduate level seminar on my plate that I had to be prepared for every day of the week and it took a while to find my footing.
